intro: Thyella hirtiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered thyella, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
